page.title: 05Water in Morwenstow
page.content:
The streams that flow in our block are stoney and brown trout and eels breed in the upper reaches. Many insects including the dragonfly hatch in them.
All the tributaries meet at {Coombe {Valley}where the stream with no name meanders down to{Duckpool}and the sea. Many of the farms and homes in the block rely exclusively on wells for their water. Some are shallow spring wells built into the hillside. They are made of local stone with a wooden door on the side and a slate ledge where the butter and cream were kept. Others are vertical not ususally deep with a coventional lid on top. Farms that require more water dig bore holes In the last two summers we have had very little rain, wells and springs dried up and homes with mains water had very little pressure.
